MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Shimoamazu's doll found all these mysterious little shrines.
The scenery seems to warp all around us.

This is clearly sorcery, and quite powerful at that. I've never seen anything like this before.
No wonder they call her the most powerful sorcerer of Mt. Ooe.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
That's an exaggeration. I am good at sorcery, but only at things like seals and manipulation.
I can't do everything.
What kind of sorcery was that just now?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: This is sorcery to call the spirits of ownerless dolls who've lost their owners to this world.
So there are dolls sleeping in those shrines?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Exactly.
Good guessing.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
To be more specific, they're the physical manifestation of those dolls' wandering spirits. What form they take is different depending on the doll,
but their bodies no longer exist in this world.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Even if they're burned to ashes, if they can't cross over, they're left to wander this world.
Both humans and dolls are the same in that way.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Now then, who's our friend for today?

Shimoamazu opens the shrine door without hesitating.
She takes out a Nishiki doll.

The doll's wearing a beautiful kimono.
It's in such good condition, it's hard to believe it's been outdoors. It looks brand new.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
This one lost its body right after meeting its owner. They were about to make lots of wonderful memories together,
so I'm sure it was difficult to accept the reality.

She speaks sweetly as she pets the doll's head.
Just like she was talking to a lost child.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Hi there. My name is Shimoamazu.
Dolly, could you tell me a little about yourself?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Your kimono is very beautiful. It's just perfect for you. It looks a bit expensive, though. Did your owner give it to you?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I see... Your owner still hasn't come back.
Don't worry. I'll take you to them.

The doll in her arms doesn't stir one bit. And of course I can't hear it speak.
If someone didn't know what was happening, it would just look like she was playing with the doll by herself.
But she can definitely hear the doll's voice. She's not playing around or talking to herself. I can see her eyes waver as she nods. The doll is clearly pulling at her heartstrings.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It seems like this doll's owner was a girl who lived here.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
It says there was a village here, so it might have passed away a very long time ago.
After all, I've never heard of a town or village on this mountain...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
You've been waiting here for a very long time.
It's not that far from the town, but people don't come here often, so you must have been lonely, huh?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I'll take you to where your owner is now.
Now then, close your eyes, and think of your dear friend...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
You'll make lots of memories on the other side.
I'm sure your owner really wants to see you again too.

Shimoamazu begins to chant again,
still clinging to the doll.

The scenery around us warps again. I can feel strong magical energy. It's an eerie sensation, like when the Mist appears. But Shimoamazu doesn't falter one bit. She simply continues to hold the doll and chant the same incantation.

The doll's physical manifestation is gone. It might be long gone by now.
But still, she doesn't let go of her arms, crossed in front of her.
I see... It's still there.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: ...It's over now.
Did the doll get to meet its owner again?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
No.
I don't think so.
Shimoamazu speaks quietly, her back still turned to me.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Human souls and doll souls don't go to the same place. So when their owners die,
they lay them to rest as well, praying that they can journey together...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
So when the dolls are left behind, even if their bodies rot, they can't give up on their masters.
I find those lost souls and use that incantation to release them from their lingering attachments.

Releasing them from their attachments...
So in other words, you erase their memories.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Yes. What I'm doing for them isn't a memorial service. But leaving souls like that alone can be dangerous.
You know that well too, don't you?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I don't need anyone to praise me.
But I think there's a lot of jobs in this world that need someone to do them anyway.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Breaking things that others treasure, giving up children to another's care,
sealing an undefeatable enemy inside of someone...

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
There are times when someone has to do those things. It takes a great deal of resolve.
I want to be a strong and responsible sorceror.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: —Just like Amano's mother who sealed the Great Demon in her body.

Her back is still turned to me as she speaks,
and I embrace her softly from behind.

I don't want to take her place, or to break the chains between them.
I just want her to rely on me a little more.

I whisper this in her ear,
and Shimoamazu blushes a bit.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I am relying on you.
That's why I asked you to come with me.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Shimoamazu
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Hey, I'll lend you a comb, so would you comb my hair? I'll do the doll's hair.
Let's play together, just the three of us.
—Just two of the special mitarashi dango that she put on the stump as an offering were missing.
